pullRequest.title: Generate genesis state incrementally
pullRequest.bodyText:
PR Description
When processing deposits from the ETH1 chain, incrementally build up the genesis state rather than creating a genesis state from scratch.  Significantly speeds up building genesis and avoids the risk that the first genesis candidate we build isn't suitable (e.g. because some deposits were invalid) and we'd then repeat the whole process on the next deposit.

commit.message: Incrementally generate genesis state as deposits are received.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:PegaSysEng/artemis into incremental-genesis
Provide accessor to unconditionally get genesis state.

nodes.bodyText: We were incorrectly storing the validator index even if the deposit was invalid. We would have incremented the wrong balance if there was a later, valid deposit for that validator as it would have used the cached index from the invalid deposit even though the validator didn't actually get created then.
(nit) why not initialize a beaconStateWithCache, since it was like that previously too.

(nit) we can avoid nesting:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                if (index != null) { // Could be null if the deposit was invalid
          
          
            
                if (index == null) return  // Could be null if the deposit was invalid
I couldn't find where we verify the merkle proof that we've generated. Or do you mean that we don't need to since we only generate one merkle proof here?
